TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed HttpHandlerActionCollection extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection
Public NotInheritable Class HttpHandlerActionCollection Inherits ConfigurationElementCollection

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of elements. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerActionCollection> collection type allows access to the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> elements of the configuration section.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerActionCollection> collection to access the information contained by the `httpHandlers` section of a configuration file.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers/CS/httphandlers.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers/VB/httphandlers.vb#2)]
The following configuration excerpt shows how to specify values declaratively for the `httpHandlers` section.
``` <httpHandlers> <add path="Calculator.custom" type="Samples.AspNet.SystemWebConfiguration.Calculator, CalculatorHandler" verb="GET" validate="false" /> </httpHandlers> ```

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerActionCollection.%23ctor%2A> constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code. It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system. You obtain an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerActionCollection> class by using the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlersSection.Handlers%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Add(class System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction httpHandlerAction) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds an object to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Before using this method you must create an <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> object and initialize it with the proper name and type. After that, you can add the object just created to the collection.
> [!NOTE] > ASP.NET searches for the handler assembly DLL in the application's private Bin directory first, and then it searches in the system assembly cache.
The collection must not already contain an <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> object with the same <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction.Verb%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction.Path%2A> properties.
## Examples The following code example shows how to create an <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> object and add it to the collection.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers/CS/httphandlers.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers/VB/httphandlers.vb#3)]

Docs.exception: The object to add already exists in the collection or the collection is read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes all objects from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method inserts a `clear` directive into the appropriate section of the configuration file to clear all references to elements defined in a higher-level configuration file. All elements defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file are removed.
## Examples The following code example shows how to clear the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> objects contained in the collection. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerActionCollection> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers/CS/httphandlers.cs#12)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers/VB/httphandlers.vb#12)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks Before using this method, you must identify an <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> object with the proper name and type. You can then use this object to get its collection index.
## Examples The following code example shows how to obtain an <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> object collection index.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers#9](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers/CS/httphandlers.cs#9)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers#9](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers/VB/httphandlers.vb#9)]

Docs.summary: Removes an object from the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Remove(class System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction action) cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes an object from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method inserts a `remove` element into the appropriate section of the configuration file for any element defined in a higher-level configuration file. If the element is defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file, its entry is removed from the configuration file. The object to remove must exist in the collection.
## Examples The following code example shows how to remove an <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> object from the collection.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers/CS/httphandlers.cs#10)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers/VB/httphandlers.vb#10)]

Docs.exception: The passed object does not exist in the collection, the element has already been removed, or the collection is read-only.
